number of helpful: 1,019 of 1,088 people (94%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
er 4, 2013
												DayZ is a mod for Arma 2 that turns the base game into a zombie survival simulator. DayZ is one of the most detailed, if not the most detailed, and immersive zombie survival sims available. When you play DayZ, you create a character and spawn on a beach with nothing but your clothes and from there you have to make your way inland and try to find the tools you need to fend off the undead and to survive in this new world. Generally you are looking for things such as a melee weapon, medical supplies, light sources, food and you might even be lucky enough to find a gun or camping gear.As you make your way through formerly populated areas like villages, farms and the three large cities, you will run into hordes of zombies that you will have to deal with. You can lose them by running into buildings or otherwise breaking line of sight with them. But the zombies are actually not the real threat in this game; the biggest potential threat comes from the other players who are attempting to survive just like you. Some of them will try to help you or trade with you, but usually in exchange for something of equal value, or if you are both being attacked by zombies or other players and you band together out of desperation. Most players though, are bandits, which you can tell by their clothes and covered faces. These players are out for your blood, and only want the stuff they can loot off your dead body.You want to be very cautious in approaching other survivors that you do not know in DayZ because a lot of bandit groups will try to bait victims by having one of their number pose as a "friendly" and then when the victim runs over to trade or help, the rest of the bandits ambush him or her. Players in this game have gotten very paranoid in the last year and a half, and so a lot of times players will shoot each other on sight rather than risk losing their gear to a potential bandit.So what do you actually do in DayZ once you have your basic weapons and tools needed to survive? Well you want to find a safe place that you can use as a home base. Generally you want to be far away from areas frequented by zombies, so somewhere in the woods usually. You want to be close enough to a town that you can raid it for supplies every few hours but far enough that zombies and players will have a difficult time tracking you home.Once you have your things safely stashed, the best thing you can do is band together with your friends or any friendly people on the server you can find and get a vehicle. A bicycle is great for solo scout and loot missions to town, but a car, truck or SUV will provide cover from bullets, a large inventory and quick transport for multiple people. Focus on getting the necessary car parts you will need to fix up one of the junked cars you find laying around. After that, once you get enough loot and establish a territory, you can even build a house in some versions of DayZ and barricade it against zeds and meddlesome players.At some point you will get into a fight with another player. Most of the time these fights aren't fair. Maybe a group of players rolled up on you while you were looting and shot you as you came out of a house. Other times you'll follow someone and not realize that they have friends with them and their friends flank and kill you, or you just get shot by someone while you are running from zombies that have aggroed you. All of these things will happen to you on a regular basis, and since everything stays on your corpse when you die, chances are they will loot and take your stuff. But other times you get lucky and you kill a guy with a huge gun that you need because you were lucky enough to catch him with his pants down. So now you have a big gun, and then when you go around the side of the house he was in, you find his giant military truck full of more guns and supplies. Now you are a zombie slaying god and you can bring all of that back to your base. It is very easy to either get very, very mad at this game and ragequit or try to keep deaths in perspective, play smart and take all the opportunities you get. If you are observant and patient in every situation you will do well. If you run into a building without checking the surroundings for players watching or for zombies that will attract attention to you, you will die a lot. If you take your time and all necessary precautions you will catch somebody making a mistake and profit from it, and continue to survive the apocalypse.

content:
r 4, 2015
												DayZ Epoch Namalsk Gameplay:


YouTube™ Video: RUNNING SCARED! - DayZ - Ep.41 

			Views: 3,752,693		

			Thought the Governor's tank got destroyed! 1 hour is probably too long for a DayZ Episode, but wanted to see :D So Merry Xmas!		

Important Notice:There are currently over 2,000 servers[dz.launcher.eu], but this Steam download alone won't be enough to connect to the vast majority of them. Most servers require additional mods and maps. You'll get an error and fail to connect if you are missing mods. DayZ launchers are free utilities that solve this issue. I highly recommend using one to make installing mods and connecting to servers much easier.Server list by country: http://arma2.swec.se/server/listIf you are new to DayZ before installing a launcher make sure to run Steam.exe as an Admin and then install and play Arma 2 and Arma 2 OA once each to complete installation (part of the installation occurs when playing the games). Next install a launcher to download mods and connect to servers:dayzlauncher.com - All DayZ Modswithsix.com - All Arma Mods (official)survivallauncher.com - Arma 2 & 3 + Arkcustomcombatgaming[customcombatgaming.com] - CCG DayZ Serversdayzcommander.com - All DayZ Mods (currently not working)See: Newbie Guide to DayZ LaunchersPlease note that you will not be able to connect to any server until you have fully downloaded the mods necessary for that server. Vanilla DayZ is only about 500MB, but others like Epoch are 2.6GB and will take quite a while to download. Maps are also fairly large, for example Namalsk is an additional 800MB and Taviana is 1.2GB. The good news is all these mods and maps are completely free! Check the Mods tab of your launcher to view the status of your downloads before trying to connect.Interactive DayZ Mod loot maps: http://dayzdb.com/map/chernarusScreenshot after building my first DayZ Epoch base, a long time ago in a galaxy far far away (all that wood was chopped down by hand with axes!): http://i.imgur.com/88nBhSC.jpgDayZ Mod is one of the most interesting, exciting and immersive games I've ever played. It's basically a multiplayer apocalyptic virtual world or sandbox without any quests or story-line unless created by the players themselves. You go where you want and do as you want. You determine everything that happens except for the response from other players. You can be a bandit or hero engaging in constant gun battles in the busier towns or you can run off into the wilderness and build yourself a cabin in the middle of nowhere and hunt to survive. There are very few limits on what you can do.DayZ Epoch (mod) Building & Craftinghttp://epochmod.gamepedia.com/Modular_Building_Systemhttp://epochmod.gamepedia.com/Crafting_SystemI prefer DayZ Mod over DayZ Standalone for several reasons. One of the coolest things about the Mod is that it's essentially a game with hundreds of free expansions and DLCs. Because it's not centrally controlled and developed by a single dev team it offers many different types of games, maps, custom mods, play styles i.e PvP, PvE, RP, and game improvements for free from hundreds of players and community developers and continues to evolve in many alternative directions. Most mods are open source and you can modify them or help develop and improve them yourself. There are Hunger Games type mods to play like Battle Royal where it's everyone for themselves and you fight to be the last one standing, militarized mods like Overwatch full of heavy military weapons, aircraft and tanks, crafting and base building type mods like Epoch and Origins that allow you to more permanently carve out your own piece of the world and make it your home, survival type mods like vanilla DayZ, and even alien mods like Invasion. With the Mod there are so many different options and environments available for play that you're bound to find a server that suits you and if you don't you can even set up your own server and customize it just the way you like. That will likely never happen to the same degree with the Standalone.800 free mods are available for Arma 2: http://withsix.com/p/arma-2/modsThe Mod is also much cheaper than Standalone. Arma 2 Combined Operations and Arma X Anniversary keys can be bought for about $5 and $8 each, just search Google for keys or wait for a sale. Not only do you pay less and get dozens of different games and options for play, but you also get the original Arma 2 combat simulator games too, which are award winning games themselves.Overall, DayZ Mod is a must have if you enjoy PC gaming. Many games are trying to imitate DayZ Mod now, but nothing really compares so far and it will probably remain that way simply because free DayZ mods are community developed by those purely passionate about making cool mods and games while everything else is being developed primarily for profit.If you need help installing or connecting send me a friend request and I'll try to help.

content:
er 25, 2013
												Two tips: 1. "Don't get too fond of your gear".... You are going to lose it. All of it. Many times.2. Elekrovadask is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ where you will usually meet a sticky end. Its a free mod. But If you are going to buy Arma2 and OA just to play the mod, proceed with caution. You need to install and set it up very carefully and use DZLauncher or it probably won't work "out of the box".   (NOTE: DayZ Commander is now out of date)It is built on a military simulator engine, and there is a fairly sharp learning curve, it may take a while to find a regular server that plays the style of DayZ that you like (ranging from solo survivalist in the woods PvE to relentless PVP and everything between the two extremes)It is NOT a "run and Gun" game. Its about stealth, walking, sneaking, surviving the hard way, and the highs and lows of living moment to moment.There are bugs, and gliches.  You will either be able to overlook these and enjoy the game, or they'll drive you mad.Under the surface there is a very good community. Although dismissed my many in the Arma2 community as "whiny trolls from DayZ" there are plenty of us who play both the mil-sim and the DayZ variants of Arma2. DayZ is not for everyone. It may take you a while to find a server you like, with an FPS that works, and a decent anti-cheat on it. But there are servers for everyone, from Pure PVP, to Pure PvE, and everything in between including servers witth hostile/friendly AI, and mods-on-mod like Epoch and Origins.TL/DR: do your research first: there are no half measures in DayZ, you will either love it or hate it.

content:
er 2, 2014
												Hallelujiah, the Apocalypse has arrived. (TL:DR at bottom)I bought into DayZ StandAlone last year. For a year I've been trying to participate in and enjoy, that game, and rarely have I walked away pleased. The glitches, hackers and terrible zoombie mechanics left me disappointed too many times to recommend StandAlone.When I saw Arma 2 Complete go on sale for less than $9 I had serious reservations about giving Bohemia any more of my money, but I really wanted a DayZ experience the devs have promised me dang rabbit!So, I pulled the trigger and purchased Arma 2 Complete and immediately kissed the rest of the games in my library goodbye!Set-up wasn't easy, I was plauged by the error messages seen everywhere in the forums by recent puchasers of the same set, but with some patience, determination and a LOT of reading I was able to overcome the BattleEye bugs and, again, with some little annoyances I also got DayZ Commander set up and the Epoch & Overwatch mods installed..now, what about this DayZ mod?My time is recorded through Arma 2 OA so since purchasing Thursday so I'm closer to 15 hours in and it's been absolutely AMAZING. DayZ Mod was the experience I was hoping SA would bring me and never did. I've had more intense, blood curdling, panic-inducing moments in DayZ Mod than any other game on my steam list.The Zombie AI, imo, is the best on Steam. Coming from a pretty hefty zombie/survival/open-world gaming list, DZM provides more thrills than 7DTD, The Forest, The Dead Linger etc. The pathfinding is superb, the animations are great, the sounds are excellent. They provide a real atmosphere of tense-horror at just the right time.The one big issue in SA (out of many, believe me) is the zombies are still broken. The have x-ray vision which stretches miles, can run through a lot of obstacles and are very hard to "lose", imo. The zoms in DZM act exactly like I would expect zombies to act. I can't explain to you the joy I felt when I was crouched in the ditch of a road, night settling over me, with two lumbering Zeds slowly shambling my way having yet still notice me. Staying extremely still, not breathing IRL, I remained crouched as these two denizens of the undead proceeded to ramble past me, mere INCHES from my face, without knwoing I was there. One wrong move or sound from me and I was Zombie Dinner! I've been waiting for that experience for a long time, through a lot of games, and it was a joy to finally see it realized.Installing DayZ commander and getting at least Epoch and Overwatch working (out of a lot of other intense mods) are almost tantamount to give you the DayZ experience you are looking for. They add so much flavour to the game including trading posts, custom building and crafting (up to massive bases), wandering AI, including Bandits, which add SO much flair to the game, roaming bandits, Aircraft Bandits...truckloads driving from village to village looking for hapless victims to strip them off their gear and sell them at the nearest vendor. The different MODS through Commander add new maps, missions within the game (find an Alpha zombie, kill a scientist for a cure, find a downed plane for it's supplies); plus many servers have their own lore and stories built within the game. Basically you can tailor you Apocalypse scenario any way you want...creating the experience you want.Graphically I find the MOD looks almost exactly like the SA, and plays very smooth. I have a mid-grade pc and on the server I have picked as my favorite so far I have been getting FPS in the 50's, which is great for my machine (I'm used to 30 FPS for a lot of games), so technically it isn't as demanding as I thought it might be.If you are turned off by a lot of buttons then DayZ may not be for you. It is very demanding in it's use of the keyboard, utilizing a lot of keystrokes for the experience. If you're new to this structure then allow for extra time in-game to really get a feel of the flow, but once you're used to it there is no denying how satisfying it is being able to use 4 buttons at once to scope out around corners, or scan far off to the North while feverishly running South.The Gear screen is a little confusing to me still, as I'm still fiddling with how different items work together, and I haven't even begun to touch crafting or building. But running around a few servers with player made creations shows that the system is deep and immersive. There are a lot of clans out there that have spent hundreds of hours building, scavenging for parts and building a community within the game. The nice thing is, especially through DayZ Commander, you can find as casul or hardcore an experience as you wish.I haven't come across any bugs or glitches in my almost 15 hours of play or so, not that I'm saying it's perfect, but coming from SA to the Mod I was expecting it to be a horrid, buggy mess, so I have been very pleasantly surprised with the fluidity of the game and it's contents. I have tested in many types of servers, full PVP and PVE, and have been lucky to have picked really incredible community servers, so griefing and KOS'ing (so far) have been a non-issue for me, but I do a lot of research on servers before hopping in. What I did find nice was with the addition of Bandit AI, even in  a server that's PVE with no one but me on it, the threat from man is JUST as palpable as the threat from zombies. It's quite a thrill to run into a village looking for supplies and taking out a zombie population with a silenced pistol, freely exploring buildings, and at any moment hearing the sounds of a truck coming around a corner, running to hide in a a building JUST before the headlights light you up, and watch as  5 bandits jump from a truck, fully armed, going from building to building, shooting anything they see. It's exhilarating and challenging, but in no way breaks immersion or the feeling of Apocalyptic Doom.If you can get this package on sale it's a HUGE bonus. But, to be honest, now that I'm in DayZ Mod and experiencing the thrill of DayZ as I was hoping I would have had over a year ago, the retail asking price of the package is completely worth it. For now, I am am uninstalling my DayZ Standalone, saying a silent prayer for all the games on my list that I won't touch for many months to come, and immersing myself in the Zombie Apocalypse game I have always wanted and now have found. :)TL:DR; An immersive experience that blows away it's struggling little brother DayZ Standalone. Worth the price (especially on sale), and the finest example of a Zombie Apocalypse game on Steam yet. If you can get past the installation issues and have the patience to get DayZ Coammander up and running, then this game is unparallelled.

content:
ry 2, 2014
												Although steam says I haven't played this game much, I've put about 1000-2000 hours in total using DayZ Commander. Now, being based of a Military Sim. There is some amazing gun play, tactics and all around great fun to be had. Although there are some very bad bugs and glitches. If its not glitching off a ladder and dying or lagging through walls. (Every hardcore DayZ player has had this happen to them.) Its also got a very steap learning curve. Don't let that turn you off to the game though. DayZ is all about a game based around survival. Your set in a place in Russia, so anyone who doesn't know how to read russian is gonna have alittle harder time remembering the towns. (Although after 10 or so hours, it isn't hard.) Your set in the middle of nowhere with next to nothing. You have no objective except survive the zombie infested island. You have no idea where to go, so you start running, you found a house! Grab the beans, soda and pistol of the ground. Suddenly your a threat. You meet another player, a not so friendly one at that. People call him many names, but the most common. Bandit. He wants your items, are you going to get shot, or survive. Either by running or taking the fight to him. Now, that we're done with the little story. Back to the review d:Yes, considering it is a mod. There are going to be bugs, and more then likely you WILL get mad. Its only normal. Some annoying bugs are -- Getting one hit by zombies and dying- Glitching off ladders and dying or breaking legs- Reloging and your items be missing from inventory- Glitching through walls- Zombies hitting you through walls- Zombies having horrible pathing - Zombies glitching though floorsThose are some annoying bugs, that happen normaly. But if you can look past that, there is a silver lining. Once you get passed the bugs you find an amazing experence. Just image finding a friendly group of people, running up north, getting end-game loot and finding another squad of people and having a huge gun fight. Like I said before, the gun play is amazing. So naturaly so are the gun fights. Then you find a heli, go help freshspawns or kill them(Hero/bandit), then a rogue sniper takes all you guys out. Its fun. But I highly recommend you get some friends, get on skype/teamspeak/vent etc etc and play that way, as its much more enjoyable and way easier.If your brand new to DayZ here are some beginner tips - - G = Gear- / on numpad - Changing optics on weapons- Q , E - Lean left and right- Right click to aim- Hold right click to zoom (can do while aiming)- There is no autorun feature- Z , X , C = Changing Stance- . and , = Changing channel to talk- / not on numpad to talk- Capslock - Voice chatThose are gonna be some basics your gonna need to know. Well, I hope this review helped out atleast slightly. I fully recommend this game. Just remember. Its ok to get mad. . . Cause you will, I promise. :PEDIT - This game is also very badly rendered. Meaning, anyone who doesn't have a decent computer are going to have trouble running this game. Although not impossible, you will have to get used to it. I get a solid 30 fps and about 15-20 in large citys. Which isn't very good. But its playable. Just like the bugs, if you can get passed that. There are many adventures that await you in the DayZ.

												A Mod based off the Military Simulator, ARMA II. This mod is brilliant, because it simulates very well what would it be like if you were left behinfd in an apocalypse. This game has a huge "mods in a mod" modding scene, the map is HUGE (15 square kilometers), and you'll feel like you're there when you play this. Beware two things. One, this is not for the faint of heart. Two, this is NOT OPTIMIZED. So if you don't care about having the highest FPS, here you are then. But if you do, I would wait until the Day-Z Standalone comes out, which is on its way.Bottom line though, Highly recommended besides those two issues, but mentailly preapre yourself! Also, watching 28 Days Later helps with this too :P

												This in my Opinion is the greatest Mod for a game ever known coming right up next to garry mod and killing floor and other such as that, this mod is a Open world Survival Horror Strataagy game that takes the player into a beautiful large map with other survivors to pretty much survive the zombie Apocolypse, this includes- Eating Food ((There is also rotten food you cannot eat and animals you can hunt cook and eat for better results))- Drinking ((Water, Coke, Pepsi, Mountin Dew, Ect))- Stealth (( Stealth is a huge part of this game, you simply cannot go in guns blazing, zombies and player will hear you see you and KILL you))- Stratagy ((In DayZ combat it is nothing like CoD, you must avoid getting shot at all costs, getting shot will knock you out or break a limb. getting shot will also make you bleed and be in shock, to fix this you will have to take pain killers to stop you character from shaking, bandage your wounds, Morphine can be used for broken Limbs, blood bags will help regain colour to your screen and also stop your player from falling in and out of coma but on some servers may only be applied by other players))- People Skills ((Some people will kill on sight others will be friends, in order to survive you must know the difference))- Enviroment ((You also must make sure not to get too hot nor cold))This Mod has come so far, it now has its own standalone in witch i reviewed and multiple versions of the mod, popular ones areDayZDayZ EpochDayZ OverpochDayZ 2017This is a very well thought out mod and does a amazing job.My personal Suggesed PC SpecsCPU- Intel Quod CoreRAM- 4Gb min ((Recommend 8Gb, 16Gb is over kill and not needed))Graphics- 1Gb Nvidia Gforce ((if you have better this will be good))In conclusion i do recomend this game %100. :)

content:
2016
												DayZ is a mod for Arma 2 that turns the base game into a zombie survival simulator. DayZ is one of the most detailed, if not the most detailed, and immersive zombie survival sims available. When you play DayZ, you create a character and spawn on a beach with nothing but your clothes and from there you have to make your way inland and try to find the tools you need to fend off the undead and to survive in this new world. Generally you are looking for things such as a melee weapon, medical supplies, light sources, food and you might even be lucky enough to find a gun or camping gear.As you make your way through formerly populated areas like villages, farms and the three large cities, you will run into hordes of zombies that you will have to deal with. You can lose them by running into buildings or otherwise breaking line of sight with them. But the zombies are actually not the real threat in this game; the biggest potential threat comes from the other players who are attempting to survive just like you. Some of them will try to help you or trade with you, but usually in exchange for something of equal value, or if you are both being attacked by zombies or other players and you band together out of desperation. Most players though, are bandits, which you can tell by their clothes and covered faces. These players are out for your blood, and only want the stuff they can loot off your dead body.You want to be very cautious in approaching other survivors that you do not know in DayZ because a lot of bandit groups will try to bait victims by having one of their number pose as a "friendly" and then when the victim runs over to trade or help, the rest of the bandits ambush him or her. Players in this game have gotten very paranoid in the last year and a half, and so a lot of times players will shoot each other on sight rather than risk losing their gear to a potential bandit.So what do you actually do in DayZ once you have your basic weapons and tools needed to survive? Well you want to find a safe place that you can use as a home base. Generally you want to be far away from areas frequented by zombies, so somewhere in the woods usually. You want to be close enough to a town that you can raid it for supplies every few hours but far enough that zombies and players will have a difficult time tracking you home.Once you have your things safely stashed, the best thing you can do is band together with your friends or any friendly people on the server you can find and get a vehicle. A bicycle is great for solo scout and loot missions to town, but a car, truck or SUV will provide cover from bullets, a large inventory and quick transport for multiple people. Focus on getting the necessary car parts you will need to fix up one of the junked cars you find laying around. After that, once you get enough loot and establish a territory, you can even build a house in some versions of DayZ and barricade it against zeds and meddlesome players.At some point you will get into a fight with another player. Most of the time these fights aren't fair. Maybe a group of players rolled up on you while you were looting and shot you as you came out of a house. Other times you'll follow someone and not realize that they have friends with them and their friends flank and kill you, or you just get shot by someone while you are running from zombies that have aggroed you. All of these things will happen to you on a regular basis, and since everything stays on your corpse when you die, chances are they will loot and take your stuff. But other times you get lucky and you kill a guy with a huge gun that you need because you were lucky enough to catch him with his pants down. So now you have a big gun, and then when you go around the side of the house he was in, you find his giant military truck full of more guns and supplies. Now you are a zombie slaying god and you can bring all of that back to your base. It is very easy to either get very, very mad at this game and ragequit or try to keep deaths in perspective, play smart and take all the opportunities you get. If you are observant and patient in every situation you will do well. If you run into a building without checking the surroundings for players watching or for zombies that will attract attention to you, you will die a lot. If you take your time and all necessary precautions you will catch somebody making a mistake and profit from it, and continue to survive the apocalypse.

content:
er 6, 2014
												(This is For DayZ: Epoch, because lets be real, who the f**k still plays normal Mod)It may look a little dated and be a bit buggy, but DayZ Epoch is better than Standalone in every single possible way, except maybe Arma 2s appaling inventory system.Set a little while after the Apocalypse, Epoch sees society slowly being rebuilt, so there is more of a focus in faction forming and base building and the like rather than surviving, trader cities are on the map where you can go to sell weapons/equipment/food for small chunks of Copper, silver and gold, each with increasing value respectivley. The player can actually purchase ammo/weapons/food/Helicopters/cars/equipment from NPC's without having to find it which in my oppinion is alot better. However, as mentioned above, you need currrency to buy these things. So in order to do that, you need to either scavenge or go do bandit missions.Scvenging is almost completley redundant but is ALOT safer than bandit missions, bandit missions are small waypoints on the map where the player and his m8s can kill NPC bandits and take their supplies to sell, this is VERY dangerous because the bandits usually number from 10-25. HOWEVER it is worth it as you can get a lifetime supply of guns/ammo and maybe even a car, that is unless another player doesnt get there first, or shoots you while you scavenge the NPC bodies. Keep in mind, one stray STANNAG round (most common type) can cripple you if not kill you, so be careful, bandit missions are best done with friends.Unlike Standalone, Epoch has a humanity system which increases as you heal and help other players, and decreases rapidly upon injuring or killing another, once 5000 or negative 5000 humanity is reached, the player becomes a hero (positive) or a bandit (negative) once one of the two, the player can travel to hero/bandit traders that sell increadibly more powerful gear (Kevlar vests, Armoured cars, Armed Helicopters, and even on some servers, tanks) This is why people on Epoch are generally more friendly because having postive humanity can get them to Hero status and thus better gear.It takes a while, but you can build massive bases from scratch to house all your items, these can be as simple as small, well fortified bunkers, to massive sprawling fortresses complete with three helipads and a airoplane runway.Overall, Epoch can be tedious, but with friends it is a blast. Bandit missions are one of the highlightes of the game, and returning from a succesful one with your car loaded with guns to your very own base is an amazing feeling. Any fans of the Walking dead series or any other zombie production ever will love this game. A must buy.P.S Be prepared, The distant rumble of a armoured car engine, or the growl of an armed blackhawk will never sound scarier, especially when its headed towards your location.

content:
, 2016
How to Install DayZ Mod 2016Favorite Vid (DayZ Overpoch Taviana)


YouTube™ Video:  

			Views: 0		



InstallationIf you haven't installed anything yet make sure you are on a Windows Admin account and simply install Arma 2 and Arma 2 Operation Arrowhead (OA). Do not install the Steam DayZ mod. Before you do anything else play Arma 2 once and exit, then play Arma 2 OA once and exit, in that order. Then download dayzlauncher.com install it and run it. If all your game files are on your main C: drive then all you need to do is click the arrow button on the right side next to any server and the mods for that server will be detected and begin downloading. Some of the mods like Epoch are up to 3 GB in size and will take a while to download before you can actually connect. You can view the status of your mods and downloads by clicking the Mods page near the top of dayzlauncher. To start playing quickly you might want to start with plain old vanilla DayZ since it is only .5 GB - to see only vanilla DayZ servers select DayZ in the selection box on the left side of dayzlauncher and then click the Apply button. NOTE: do not install the old DayZ mod on Steam as it may cause conflicts.If you have multiple drives make sure to change your game folders in Dayzlauncher. Click Settings in the top right. The default location for your Mods/Download Path is your Arma 2 OA folder, typically: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Arma 2 Operation ArrowheadThe Arma 2 Path is where you installed Arma 2, typically: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Arma 2TroubleshootingUsually problems are caused by having ♥♥♥♥ed up Windows folder permissions. Make sure you install the game on a Windows Admin account. If your installation is screwed up try reinstalling this way:1. Uninstall everything and delete the following folders:C:\Users\[username]\Documents\ArmA 2C:\Users\[username]\AppData\Local\ArmA 2C:\Users\[username]\AppData\Local\ArmA 2 OAC:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Arma 2C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Arma 2 Operation Arrowhead2. Right click and run steam.exe (not the icon) as an Admin it's located at C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam3. Install Arma 2 and Arma 2 Operation Arrowhead.4. As Admin play Arma 2 and then exit. Next, play Operation Arrowhead and then exit.5. Install dayzlauncher.com (see above for usage). Do not install DayZ Mod on Steam.TipsIn Dayzlauncher settings check Nosplash, Nopause, and Nologs to load and run the game faster.DayZ Epoch servers are usually the easiest for beginners because they have high loot and NPC traders.If you don't like PvP search Dayzlauncher for PVE, RP, or Roleplay.Zombies chase noisy players. Crouch to make less noise and crawl to make almost no noise. Melee weapons are quiet.The branches of pine trees and large bushes will protect you from zombie attacks.One of the first things you need is storage. Create or get a stash, crate, backpack, or tent as soon as possible.You can drink out of ponds and wells with a chance of infection. Boil water using a tin can, waterbottle and fire.An axe is one of the most useful items. You can quitely kill zombies with it and chop wood for crafting storage and bases.More to come...

ber 26, 2015
												I'm going to be honest here. 2 or 1 year ago I wouldn't have recommended this mod. As this mod is brilliant and phenomenal it has been very unstable since it was relased early 2013. The concept sounded cool but back then DayZ had dozens of issues which prevented me playing and enjoying this otherwise so supreme title. Glitching zombies, clumsy and buggy user interference and constant uncertainity of losing everything you had collected caused by server crash were serious problems. However - what could one expect from the free mod for players of ARMA2 and ARMA2: Operation Arrowhead?Fortunantly DayZ mod has grown these past years. With the help of active community it has gotten various new maps, the UI have been enchanted and is much more easier and safer to use. Third party management programs such as DayZ launcher and DayZ Commander have done indispensable work releasing players of most of the updating burden. Of course this mod still isn't flawless and some annoying surprices happen every now and then, but considering how well it has gotten upgreaded these last years I say the future looks encouraging. DayZ mod prospers and lives well and dozens of servers have always players to keep the game hectic and interesting where - or when ever you play. DayZ mod is still one of the greatest survival, open world titles in the world and at the moment imo it is DayZ standalone's superior.

content:
26, 2014
												This is up there in my Top 3 Best Mods of all time. Easily.The changes made to the base game aren't earth-shattering, and upon close inspection of how those changes are implemented, it quickly becomes appearent how simple and rudimentary thier construction is in most cases. The changes are basically achieved with what amounts to a digital "spiral notebook and some still photographs of new textures". But with those simple tools, the cats behind DayZ:Mod have really sunk thier teeth in and hit the zombie survival nail on the head.This isn't your "L4D: KILL IT ALL! KILL IT ALL WITH FIRE!" button masher. With DayZ being built ontop of what can be classified as no less than a tried and true "Military Personell Simulator" (without even a fraction of the paper work and ten times the unaccounted-for munitions.)When I played EVE Online, I figured it would be many years before I saw a game even pretend to compare to the treachery it inspires in its player-base. But DayZ may have perhaps surpassed the deceit of EVE. Not in scale (the scale of player-betrayal in EVE is second to none) but in how immediate, and visceral it is force-fed to new players. And its a self-sustaining beast, since players who were initiated so cruely, tend to turn around and laugh harder and be more cruel to the next guys. And this can really ruin games like this, and can instantly rob people of thier entire evening of what they thought would be enjoyable play time to test out some of the mechanics, and replace that with having to wade through the mud and the rain for five miles back to thier corpse. After having been mercilessly made fun of as if we were born yesterday for not knowing an entire wiki cover-to-cover on our first day, and simply wanting to talk, make new friends, and leave some of the game to be discovered naturally through first hand experience. I'm often made fun of for my stand-point here, and ridiculed with "Aww, poor baby doesn't like dying." I genuinely don't mind dying. In fact it can spawn some really fun and exciting nemesis situations between rivaling players. But a line has to be drawn, players should be given a chance to get thier feet wet, grasp the mechanics, or survive long enough to see thier buddy(s) log in to play together. Don't feed the beast guys...work together...even if you aren't on the same team. Theres no reason to be inconsiderate or rude. If you don't understand this concept and it seems contradictory to  you, give it a couple years, wait till puberty ends. You'll get it.In the mean time, if you can recruit a friend, or manage to make a new one (in all honesty) there are some incredibly enjoyable mechanics in DayZ, with the backdrop of an often gorgeous and engrossing environment that I often find myself just kick my characters legs out on the side of a hill and watching the rainstorm. Very few games have been good-looking enough to make me wanna do that, but Arma2:OA is definitely one of them, as well as DayZ.If anyone has trouble surviving the plethora of errors and installation pitfalls, I'm usually willing to offer any help I can. And if you're interested in joining a group / server with me, I'm always on the look out for mature, calm players that enjoy the cooperative prospects of online games like this. Even the most knowledgeable and technically savvy players will require quite a bit of help in grasping / manipulating one of the most UN-intuitive interfaces I've ever seen, again easily comparable to the GrandCanyon'esque "learning curve". And even if you've been warned of everything that can and will go wrong, things will still stop you in your tracks and have you scratching your head. Many of the in-game menus are a bit convoluted, much of the environment is in Russion, and many things often have an almost "unfinished" feel to them. But that being said, I can admiringly say that the good certainly out-weighs the bad in my book. Just don't come alone ;) Bring a friend. Buy an extra copy or two. And work through it together. It's definitely not a 12 year olds CoD weekend-warrior FPS game.This is a cruel, harsh, unforgiving, cursed mod for an already teeth-grindingly difficult simulator of sorts. But with a little luck, and a helping hand (trust NO ONE for your first entire week, no matter what) maybe you'll uncovered the addictive, immersive, awesome-fest of DayZ

content:
r 12, 2015
												In a world of so few friends, I begin to realize that we dont get to choose our friends, we dont get to decide how they act, and worse of all how that comradre is severed. There was probably a better way, but bordering on almost 20 hours with about 4 hours sleep, my mind was frazzled and couldnt see a better alternative.just 15 or so hours earlier, we had been a tightly knit unit. laughing, argueing, and generally enjoying ourselves. But one certain problem began to crop up in the group, with a specific person. There was a systematic failure to communicate. As gear began to dissapear, it was obvious, very obvious, who was stealing it. Finally when a ghillie suit disappeared, and this individual claimed to have found it in a barn, the level of distrust was pushed over the line by the lies. lies told well are one thing, but lies as transparent as this spoke to how little he thought of our intelligence. We discussed what we should do in a seperate message on steam.......................................................................................................................................I didn't pull the trigger my self, in fact, i didnt even hear the shots go off. But as i fortified my base, i also saw him leave, i hadn't even been sure when it would happen. Just as i finished making my base sealed off, i saw the words.Wolfy was killedEerie as ♥♥♥♥ for a brief secondfollowed by the exasperated sounding words "Dude.....What the ♥♥♥♥?"The conversation that ensued was that reminiscient of an ugly Divorce. I didn't speak much during this, But he was presented with the facts. He denied these vehemently, trying to blame others. He claimed he had no choice but to kill us, now. After awhile of this i spoke up and agreed with the triggerman, he had crossed a line. the conversation degraded into denials and insults. There was nothing else to do but hang up and delete him from steam.As our reality begun to settle around us, the impact of what we had done hit us full force. the person we had spent almost 20 consecutive hours with, looting, shooting the ♥♥♥♥, and even executed several well coordinated operations with, was dead. not the kind of dead where, when he respawns he'll just meet us at base. no, this felt real. it felt real because we knew him. we knew him on a personal level. the diffrence between killing someone with whom ive never had extended interaction with, and killing wolfy was monumental. It felt real. As we discussed it and dissected what it was,and how wierd we felt, we came back to one amazing fact. An amazing fact that we have always known, one that sharply blew our minds. it was so obvious. This is a video game. How? Just How? we began to discuss that too. After having disscussed at depth for about an hour, we slowly went back to our normal habits. hunting and gathering supplies. wolfy was out of our minds soon after. However he is still in the back of our minds, and this morning after three hours of sleep i feel heart broken. I Very much expect that wolfy is equally heartbroken, but that this will be masked with rage and un-adult rated vengence. we have to relocate now, and despite this base being a dream come true. i know i cannot fight him off 24/7. i know we cannot undo what we did. words have been exchanged, actions have been taken. So with heavy hearts we pick up and move on, knowing now we have a mortal enemy...................................................................................................................................................................................All in all the level of immersion in this game is second to none. The learning curve is hard. but if you persevere you will find yourself having adventures unique and all their own. sometimes what happens is even more dramatic then any games storyline. bandits suck, yes but if you find the right server, youll have a little wiggle room. start off with smaller servers go big later.

Exploded and killed us all.TIP FOR NEW PEOPLE: Don't use towing features on servers. Solo play is hard if your planning on it. Always try to stay in a group and out of major towns.

content:
r 5, 2014
												It's terrirfying at times and consistantly unnerving, it's  hard to master as there's always something impeding your progress be it bandits, untrusting/trigger happy survivors, zombies or yourself, i say yourself as it's a game that is very unforgiving in the choices you make. It contains a vast map that seems impossible to learn, only after multiple hours of playtime will you get the lay of the land. Stay on the coastline or head inland? Will you live discreetly from a tent in a forest or openly in a fortified compound?Your morality will be tested, will you be a hero (help survivors) or a bandit (kill survivors)? Will you team up with other people ingame/friends or lone wolf it? But remember obviously there are advantages and disadvantages in whatever options you choose. I highly recommend this game/mod.

content:
, 2016
												There are about 2,000 DayZ mod servers of all varieties from roleplay to PvP. Get dayzlauncher.com to access them all.Live DayZ server stats: http://dz.launcher.eu/statsDayZ Mod Official Trailer by Dean Hall


YouTube™ Video: DayZ - The Survivors 

			Views: 4,462,542		

			Welcome to Chernarus. A 225 km2 open world post-soviet state and one of the areas hit by a new and presently unknown infection which has wiped out most of the world's population.		

The correct install of Arma 2 and Battleye is a pain in the ♥♥♥. Here is what works for most:1. Exit Steam. Right click Steam shortcut and select Open file location. Right click on steam.exe and select Run as administrator.2. As Administrator install both Arma 2 and Arma 2 Operation Arrowhead.3. As Administrator play Arma 2 all the way to the multiplayer menu and exit. Then do the same for Operation Arrowhead. Don't skip this!4. Install and run dayzlauncher.comIn Dayzlauncher you can sort the servers by connection speed by clicking on PING at the top right. Click on the play arrow along the right side next to the server you want to join. You will have to click on the Steam icon on your task bar and then click OK on the confirmation window to launch each server. You will also need to wait for mods to download the first time you try to connect to a server and can check the status of downloads by clicking on MODS at the top of dayzlauncher.I recommend playing on a DayZ Epoch or Overpoch server first because most have high loot and vehicle spawns along with NPC traders making it much easier to survive.I'm loving the game!

content:
ry 15
												Such a fun game. I never played it during the glory days (2012-13 I suppose), but still now this can thrill and challenge you.On an empty server you can play PVE style, scavenging and hunting which is great fun to begin with, but actually it's far too easy. Once you get the hang of it zombies are no threat - you can just run right by them and into a building where they suddenly become slow for no particular reason, then a quick axe to the head and you're off on your way again.So by all means learn the ropes on an empty server, but get yourself onto a full one asap. The added challenge of other players is what makes this game truly unique and thrilling. You're going to die, a lot, but that's the key point of the game. It takes time to gear up and travel to interesting places, so your character is valuable. The joy you'll feel at finding a water pump when you're thirsty is balanced perfectly with the fear of getting shot by a bandit as you drink. This game can take you on a real roller coaster ride of emotions and heart-stopping moments. Honestly, the first time you get into a car after 50 hours of endless running is just pure joy. Others in these reviews seem intent on bad-mouthing the standalone version of this game. I say get both. They're both great. This version is a simpler one, though its vehicles and the range of weapons is broader. It also has other DayZ-themed mods such as the excellent Epoch (though really that's not DayZ - too easy to get high end gear means less fear of losing it all). The standalone has far deeper mechanics for survival and player interaction which for me provides a richer and more satisfying experience. All buildings are enterable in the standalone and loot is more spread out, all of which means fewer "hotspots" in each location - and therefore meeting other people is more random and therefore even more heart-stopping! It also has better, more deadly zombies.

number of helpful: 115 of 212 people (54%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 27, 2013
												As an avid ArmA 2 ACE player, I came to DayZ for a good zombie role play experience. I wanted to get involved in the world of the apocalypse, with some of the milsim mechanics from ArmA 2. When I went into DayZ, alot of things felt spectacular - the music, the map, the saturation, the user interface, etc. I really got a good first impressions of the game. However, my experience suffered after this point. The first problem with this mod is zombie AI pathing. Zombie AI is horrid, and zombies, to me, were more of a pain in the ♥♥♥ rather than something to keep me on my toes and alert in the enviorment. While the sound and models were good, there was no recompense for their buggyness. After dying to some buggy zombies, because they were so rediculous, I then came across my first player. I did not want to play as a bandit, for I wanted to collaborate with people. In my first play session, I was sniped on my treck to Chernogorsk. After many playthroughs, I could not find a single friendly person. I came to the conclusion that there was barely ANY friendly people. This is because there is no incentive to help people! When you kill someone, you get their stuff, which was more than enough reason to kill someone. There are NO pros what-so-ever to being a hero, and that is a game mechanic that needs to be fixed.When I was being fired at, I was using alot of the milsim tactics that I used in ACE. However, the blood system in the game is horrid, and forces you to get headshots or use a sniper rifle on your opponent. I was in one firefight where I had an M4A1 CCO, and my opponent had an M9SD. After putting FIVE body shots into him, he shot me in the head once with his pistol, and that was the end of it. In a regular game of ArmA, my combatant would have been dead in a heartbeat. This mechanic really needs to be fixed.I really love the concept of DayZ, I really do. But the game is such a jumbled mess at the moment that needs to flesh out its mechanics and fix its formula to be a worthy mod. Zombie AI pathing needs to be fixed, hacking needs to be fixed, player interaction needs to be more dynamic, combat should be better, and camping should be less of an issuse. DayZ tries hard to be the ultimate zombie apocalypse simulator, but it really needs to work out its kinks before I get lost in the universe. If you are on the same boat with me, you may take interest in the DayZ Standalone, where hopefully, some of these issues will be adressed; and hell, that game looks promising.

												Pros:- the mod has a whole bunch of weapons and attachments you can use- it's realistic, for instance getting shot in the leg causes it to break- it's alive, what i mean by this is that servers are still full of people even though there's dayz standalone- the mod itself is free- free russian language lessons- there is a small amount of '' little microphone squeekers'' so you don't usually have to mute anyone- there is little to none hackers thanks to the auto kick systemCons:- it's unoptimised - there is a whole bunch of people with high end rigs that can't get 30 fps and i'm not only talking about playing in big cities- it's like cs go when it comes to russians - about 60% people in all servers are russians that speak absolutely NO english (atleast from what i have seen)- the mod is extremely glitchy, it has tons of bugs and most of them are pretty f*cking annoying, for instance zombies hear you from a mile away if not cautious, walk through stairs, doors, gates and when they run after you they usually literally make f*cking circles around you, run away and then come back for you when you thought they lost you- bandits in this game are annoying - whether you're a fresh spawn or not they'll shoot you on sight without any questions asked, but the worst type of bandit is the one that says that is friendly and then shoots you in the back when you turn aroundOverall, i think the game's really great and really fun even though it has some cons here but still i definitely recommend it>9/10

												Well goodie you can write a review on Dayz in steam nowWell I first started playing this game back in August 2012, Entered a server my buddy sent me, spawned in to a very dark night, a flashlight and sounds of zombies around me... turned on the flashlight and I see teh zombies walking around without batting an eye to me, finally my friend showed up and we headed to a elektro (one of the main cities) and since then I fell in love with the game.Never trust people completely: A lot of the player base is a bunch of a--holes who just want to steal gear and wouldn't care to shoot you down on sight, so be very careful. that is the main rule for this gameand yes the game is a little buggy but it is a heck lot better than standalone which was a big dissappointment filled with crap juice. stopped playing a year ago, decided to install the game again but this time on steam instead of DayzCommander and wow it still getting updates, though there aren't many servers, there is still one vanilla dayz server i'm playing on which is stable and brings me the same goosebumps and joyment i've got when the game was at its prime.I recommend to get this game with a buddy or two for teh full experience.

												This is, and will always be one of my favorite games of all time. I have so many stories of this game and I continue to make more stories every day. The best part about DayZ, is that you never know what is going to happen next, you could die, get a squad wipe, meet a friend that will be your friend for life, get backstabbed, find a DMR, find a can of beans, make a base, find a base, this game is all about what is going to happen next. Everyone knows everyone now. I just want to say thank you Dean Hall for making this fantatic piece, if DayZ never existed, I don't see myself playing video games. (10/10)

content:
3, 2014
												The darkness of the forest leaves you restless as you wait just in the treeline a few hundred meters away from the airfield. Pulling out your rifle, you switch on your nightvision, and aim down the southern side of the runway to the helicopter for the third time. Satisfied that no players have boarded the chopper, you put away your rifle and finally head down to the hangers about a hundred meters from the bird. Stopping just behind the fifth hanger from the north, you check the area once more for hostiles, only this time a bullet barely misses your head and slams harmlessly into a tree twenty away. Instinctively you back away behind the hanger and flank around to the other side, making sure no players threaten you from behind. Peeking from the front of the hanger, you identify the shooter, pull out your rifle, and take the shot. As you pull the trigger, three things happen; firstly, you killed the hostile player that shot at you moments ago, secondly, you've just alerted the player hiding inside the hanger to your presence, and lastly, you've alerted the mass of zombies patroling the airfield looking for fresh meat. Flanking back around to the back of the hanger, you then sprint for the chopper you've worked so hard to repair, only to get shot by the player inside the hanger you used as cover.Experiences like these are hard to come by. And ArmA 2 does it right.

												An amazing game, my time does now matter I have spent count less amount of hours on the mod. It's proberly the best game i've ever played, by you're self its no fun but when you're with a clan its a whole different ball park. Imgiane rolling in one of the main towns in a humvee with a .50 cal while a Blackhawk is giving you covering fire while you try to dodge the bulletes of an opposing clan, or when you're stalking other players at night armed with a DMR, a ghillie and a pair of Night Vision Goggles which leads up to a ten kill streak and ending in a giant fire fight. Epoch,Overwatch Etc. You have to build a base while doing all the above but its worth it! content:
12, 2014
												On one hand, DayZ is a military simulator, with all the makings of one: Bullet drop, the constant need for camouflage, and a mind-boggling ammunition system that, while being fair, forces memorization, as each weapon has its own independent ammunition. Sorry, but no shared ammo between multiple assault rifles. That M4 and AK-74 each need their own magazines. On the other hand, DayZ is also a game of survival in a brutal apocalyptic world. Not for a single second will this game hold your hand. You'll be required to cross large stretches of zombie-infested terrain to find food, water, and weapons to survive. It could be argued that your fellow survivors are just as dangerous as the infected. The big question that will ultimately shape your experience in this game is whether or not you will make an attempt to reach out and help your fellow player in his or her mission to survive.As you play, you will generally find that it seems as if the whole game is against you, and is actively attempting to either starve, shoot, or slash you to death. You wouldn't be wrong. Supplies are scarce, and zombies are common. Depending on your server population (and the nature of its community), you may also have anything from massive friendly settlements to small, trigger-happy groups of survivors attempting to forge their own way in the world. The farther you move from urban environments, the harder it will become to find things like weapons, ammunition and medical supplies. This will, eventually, force you into a situation where heading into a city is your only option. This by itself is not necessarily a bad thing: Guns, first-aid supplies and even army uniforms are all rather common in these areas. The only thing to be wary of is the watchful eye of a potential sniper.Your enjoyment of this game will stem only from your eagerness for realism and/or your hunger for a challenge. Play this game at your own risk, for it will be a long, difficult journey. But, if you are successful, you will have accumulated knowledge and power, the likes of which few survivors have ever seen.

												I love this game, simply for the fun you can have with friends.Take DayZ: Standalone, for example. That game isn't even in Beta since 3 years!Arma 2: DayZ is just cool because it's already a finished game! Okay, okay, Arma physics sometimes breaks your legs all of the sudden although you fell from a tabel but ... if we ignore that, this DayZ Mod is fun!,Finding gear and stuff takes you long but after all that's real life. You won't have awesome fire fights 24/7.Why I got this mod? From the beginning, I played this game and it just screams good old memories everytime I see the title in my steam library. The days when you could run around in a Squad with 5 people? The people shouting friendly all over the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ map? Or those times when you found a chopper, laughed your ♥♥♥ off when you realise that you're surrounded by zombies AND the chopper is pretty much useless since everything is broken? That moment when you find an awesome sniper rifle, sniping in a town and than realising that there's bullet drop?This Mod is perfect for people who like a realistic approach towards the whole "Zombie Apocalypse" Scenario. Betrayal, greed and hostility is everywhere and this just intensifies the overall game experience. You can't trust anyone. ESPECIALLY those who act like Military ... looking at you Lieutenant Dysteriylz! I'm gonna find you ...Also, the ambient sounds are f***ing awesome!

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
y 3, 2016
												I recommend this game because it is one of my personal favorite survival games.  It most definitely demonstrates what surviving against other people and zombies in a huge open world map would be like.One of the things that really stuck out to me is the fact that you get GREAT FPS, almost no lag whatsoever.  I own DayZ Standalone as well as this, and comparing the two, I've found that the Mod runs so much smoother.  I don't have the best computer, but that just proves my point even more since my computer can still handle the Mod.  And I'm not just saying I get no lag on the lowest settings, I can run the game on the highest video settings possible and it still runs as if I was playing Minecraft on the lowest settings, now that's damn good.The gameplay is extremely good for being a mod.  The mod proposes fair fights for survival against other players, as well as surviving against the environment despite other people arguing against this just because they died too many times.  I enjoy every minute of the game, even when I die.  To me dying in this game just means a brand new start and a chance to get even better gear.  You definitely learn what to do and what not to do.  The game has concequences for your actions as if you were really in a zombie apocalypse, and that just adds to the fact that the game is almost as realistic as you can get.My favorite thing on this game is the size of the map.  It's just huge.  Plain and simple.  You never run out of places to go and boredom is hard to achieve.  The size of cities/towns are acceptable, and the distance between them proposes that "journey" aspect that we all love about free roam.  Lastly, the game proposes a challenge.  Zombies are a ♥♥♥♥♥ in the beginning, but once you get weapons and such, you have bigger problems to prepare for.  Sickness, starvation, dehydration and other people.  You always have something to worry about, and that just makes the definition of survival even more present in this game.  It is survival of the fittest, and if you're not good enough, you WILL die.  That just means you have to adapt and learn to become the character you're playing as.Of course I do have a few things that I dislike that I feel like I should share with readers.-The inventory system isn't that great, It's really complicated.  I had a very hard time getting used to it, but after a while I had it down.-Zombie AI blows, it's very hard to melee or shoot a zombie if you're not good at shooting targets that jerk back and forth or do unexpected things such as run away.-The amount of controls you have to learn and master is insane.  But once again, once you learn, you don't forget.-There are so many buildings that you wish you could go into, but you can't.  Cities are made up of a ♥♥♥♥ ton of houses, and other structures but a good number of them are just decoration unfortunately.  This was quite annoying to me.-If you are just starting out, it is a real pain in the ♥♥♥ to try outrunning zombies if you don't have a weapon of some sort.  These cons are most definitely outweighed by the pros.  Watching a tutorial will help with some of these such as the control and inventory problems as well as finding ways to get past zeds when you're a fresh spawn.In conclusion, I reccomend this game for people who love a good free roam apocalyptic PVP survival game with a good challenge.  BUY IT! it's worth it!

												there have been many open world survival games but this was the first.  probably spent 1000+ hours on my first account on this game before i lost the pass. content:
y 13, 2015
												Not sure if you want to get DayZ Standalone or looking for something with more features?  Then look no further!  The Arma 2 DayZ Mod is great, and has so many different features already implemented.  Base building, vehicles, zombies, zombies, and more zombies!  I will say it is a bit of work to get it going, because as far as I know you actually cannot find any servers by loading up the DayZ Mod.  Here is what you will need to play this mod:-Arma 2 (paid)-Arma 2 Operation Arrowhead (paid)-DayZ Mod (free)-DayZ Commander (free, outside program from steam)You install all those items and then just run arma 2, arma 2 OA, and DayZ Mod once so it can do the first time setup.  Then you will never touch those programs again in steam, you will use DayZ Commander to update and launch the game.  You feel up to all that?  If you do, you like zombie survival, with big servers full of friendly players (or not friendly) then give this a go!

content:
6, 2013
												It took me a while to get into this game/mod. But after I got a couple of mates together I was soon finding myself drawn back into it time and time again.Despite the bugs, which can be forgiven because of the mod's Alpha status, this game provides an extremely immersive experience (for lack of a better term). With no missions or story presented to the player, it's up to yourself to decide your goals alongside the basic premise of simply surviving. Perhaps that's not to everyone's taste, but the stories I've been able to tell because of both successful and failed expeditions are amazing. Many a tense moment has been spent risking everything to try and get some powerful weapons or because of a frantic dash for medical supplies while close to death.A steep difficulty curve and frustrating inventory system are totally worth pushing through for some of the most exciting moments I've had playing a game with friends.

content:
ry 21, 2014
												What a nice mod! I've played many zombo games before but this one is just great. The feeling of harsh survival  is omnipresent,    threats are everywhere (either Zeds or mostly other players), a very nice detailled world filled with point of interests, quite simple UI that won't hide your field of view, option to play in third or first person when traveling or in combat and of course lots of looting to be done. Add to that the concept of perma-death a.k.a. when-you-die-you-gotta-start-over-for-real, you really have to evaluate the risks you are taking in-game. Be a Survivor, a Heroe or an infamous Bandit, the choice is yours but we all start as a "Bambie". Dayz mod is an impressive game and totally one to be tried. Worth your time.  Thanks to Frankie and Rhino for making me discover this great game, if in doubt about playing the game, go see their movies on youtube,

content:
10
-Disclosure (I only bought this during Christmas, therefore being quite a late DayZ Player.)For a game that has been abandoned by it's developers due to Standalone and Arma 3, I still believe that this game has a good vibe to it. Survival aspects are cool, however my main issues are as of follows;Issues~1. Glitches, granted it's a Mod however, I'm sure if the developers gave the game a few more months to perhaps stabalize it, and maybe code it better? Then maybe it will have an affect on the communities attitude towards the game and perhaps wouldn't have them quitting due to their hard work lost by a zombie that glitched through a wall and knocked them off the edge of a tower.2. Small Player Base, which creates a dead aspect towards Multiplayer. The big servers are your only hope, and even then it has about 40+ players sometimes, and in my opinion it's difficult to find loot on such populated servers meaning your experience isn't as spectacular as you would've seen from perhaps a Youtubers or Streamers POV.In conclusion, I do not recommend DayZ, just because the player base is slowly decreasing, although, my opinion may change in the future. Even though the game is dying, I am not prepared to declare it a bad game. So for the communities experience, I would suggest not buying the Combined Operations Pack which allows you to install DayZ Mod for full price which in GBP is £16.99, however, on sale I have seen it being reduced to £3.49. So perhaps on sale, sure buy it for the sake of it being quite a big PC Game. Rating on gameplay: 5/10

content:
er 27, 2013
												Short version: I started playing this game without having tried Arma II yet. I had no idea what I was doing, got shot at in the first few seconds and then got mauled by a zombie. 10/10Second playthrough, long version. Started off way to the southeast of the map (map takes you like well over a couple hours to cross by the way, it's pretty huge), killed a dozen zombies with a machete and nearly died trying to get into a building. Made my way 3 kilometers north to a major town while being unable to find a single scrap of food and only getting empty water bottles. Killed another dozen on my way sneaking in, filled up my water bottles and had a whole minute to drink before I got swarmed. Racked my way up to ~50 kills while barely conscious before I backed up onto a hospital roof, with the hospital now surrounded by zombies. Ate the food and water I'd managed to scrounge up, slipped down the rear ladder that only had a few zombies by it. Quietly chopped them up and slipped in, to find no medical supplies. Headed north to a military airfield, hoping it had a medical bay. On my way, found a jeep loaded with a rifle and some ammo, stole it and kept heading north. Got to the airfield, picked up an M16 but couldn't get any medical supplies. Headed off to the woods and logged off.Logged back in, drove back to the airfield and got shot by a sniper. Spawned a while away, found a second (glitched) copy of my jeep that someone had taken and crashed to the side of the road, probably dying inside it. Got in, headed back to the airfield, shot the bandit with a full mag from my glock before coming up behind him and inserting a machete into his rectal area. Got my gear back, the medical supplies I no longer needed, a new giant backpack, and a choice of the items from the 4 other dead bodies he'd killed that were laying around. Shanked some more zombies, headed in the woods with a fully loaded military jeep and an assault rifle fitted with a grenade launcher. Logged off, looking forward to blowing ♥♥♥♥ up tomororw. 10/10

5, 2014
												After the hundreds of hours spent playing this game, I can say with full confidence that it is the closest to perfect zombie survival game out there. I've tried others, but the sheer scale of the game is jaw-dropping, and the realism is incredible. However, the bugs, glitches, desync and countless amount of other problems are a drawback, but aren't enough to throw me off. A solid 8/10, but would be much more if not for the problems encountered by most players. I just hope the standalone can impress in the later stages of its development, as it is currently an awful piece of trash, but has lots of potential.

content:
er 11, 2013
												DayZ - free multiplayer modification for the computer game ArmA 2 and ArmA addition to her 2 : Operation Arrowhead, developed by Bohemia Interactive. Modification was created by one of the employees of Bohemia Interactive, New Zealand heymdyzaynerom Dean lounge as recreational additions. August 8, 2012 it was announced that Bohemia Interactive will the conversion modification in the independent game.DayZ is a survival horror in the open world. Effects of modification occurs in a fictional post-Soviet state Chernarus , whose residents as a result of a disaster turned into aggressive zombies. Managed player character has to survive in a hostile environment , avoiding enemies and extracting in abandoned buildings, weapons and supplies. Character threaten not only computer controlled zombies and other players , but also environmental factors - hunger , thirst, injury and disease. Death in the game is final and irreversible - with the death of the player character offered to join the game again , creating a new character and starting from scratch storage supplies .In a word - Hardcore:-)

content:
er 5, 2013
												DayZ is a brilliant mod and soon to have its own standalone game. Best played with a group of friends/players but can also be played alone. Also be prepared to trek the whole map (which is 100km2 ) to maximise how well you do in game. You do have to be prepared to gather alot of 'loot' and prepare to loose it in a second. The mentality of the players for the game has changed since it's growing popularity and now alot of players will shoot of sight. You might get lucky and get the one friendly guy but that's one in a million.A couple things to note before getting the mod:1. DayZ Standalone Alpha(er) is soon to be released so If you have patience, maybe waiting for the SA is a good idea2. The game is not well optimized with alot of players complaining about FPS. In the open fields you will reach your maximun FPS but towns and build up areas will effect your FPS.3. If you aren't into games which involve talking to people, just be warned that comunication with others players will slow with swapping between different chat channels, talking and moving is slightly complicated.There are alot of other factors that go with the mod like using external programs to search through servers and error problems but google is your friend and you can easily find a fix.

content:
2015
												My First day in DayZ!------------------------So these guys lived at the airfield, me being hostile and with a glock and a machete, wanted to say hi. Befor i did that i noticed that they were 7 had a chopper, 2 humvees, and 2 red offroaders and also alot of big guns. They were killing some guys, when i decided to kill 2 of them, which i did :D ( i killed 2 guys with a glock and 1 had an AK-47, and the other an Lee Enfield) after looting them i noticed there was another guy like 5 metrs behind me telling me to put down my guns. That scared the ♥♥♥♥ out of me so i got on my bike whiche was next to me and started to pedal away. I was so lucky that, that guy didnt know how to shoot, but almost killed me, i had 2000 blood left (max is 12000), and a broken leg. i drow my bike in too the woods, patched up and noticed that there was a heli above me and 2 humvees behind me, so i ran farther, i shot the heli, so it would fly away, so it did. But then i remembered the humvees. I ran into the nearest city and hid in a barn, i thought that i lost then, but they knew that i was some where close. i saw 4 of them looking for me and i managed to kille 2 of them and disconnect. the i got on my bike and ran again, till the got bored of chasing me...-------------------------------------------16/10 - would raid with a glock again :D-------------------------------------------------If you want to find out how to play and install dayz mod properly, contact me,plz, il be happy to help you, it wont take much time, depends on your internet connection :)

y 26, 2014
												Better than the standalone from what I heard, the DayZ mod is an extremely well done Arma 2 Combined Operations mod. With the great gameplay and tons of heated moments this game is great for anybody that is into survival and action games. There are some downsides though, for one the steam download is out of date, so you need to use a 3rd party software like DayZ Commander to properly lauch the game you also need a decent computer to run the game efficiently, but if you are really persistant you shouldn't have a problem running it at 30fps on lowest settings using intel integrated graphics 4000, but overal this game is great and much much better than anything else like it. Buy the games and get this mod!

												I liked the Idea of the Mod but I'm just going to pick on Gameplay. Imagine you spend 1.5hrs trying to find a gun and you get killed by a zombie or player who you assumed was friendly. The devs have to cut back on zombies and disable their run features, they should only crawl or walk slow. I get it's a SHTF situation but you would survive if you were in a group. Fortunatly for me I often get chased for 10-20 km's by zombies and I do marathons. I would reccomend the Mod, but I would reccomend to balance Zombies, Weapons, Players, Resources, Gameplay

content:
28, 2014
												Quick Note: I have many more hours in game, however since I started using DayZ Commander  to play DayZ Epoch Servers, it doesn't continue listing.In DayZ, death is inevitable... You'll start of in a massive setting you know nothing about, with no clue where to go or what to do. You'll likely try to be quick on your feet to find some useful stuff to survive, which will more then likely get you killed, and yet, you'll want to try again. Slowly you'll learn it's better to sneak around in the shadows and crawl for hundreds of feet on your belly simply to find some Frank n Beans, then before long you'll be set with supplies, proud of your accomplishments, possibly even finding a nice ride to store your loot and get around safetly until.... An unnoticed survivor in the distance decides to take your head off with his DMR. This game can be brutaly hard in the wrong situations, but very fun and fulfilling in the right ones, just remember the zeds are plenty, and trust no one because most these survivors would kill their own mother for a can of Pepsi.I'd suggest anyone who wishes to play this should get DayZ Commander and update the mod to better versions with more functionality providing more immersion. As stated above, I now play DayZ Epoch, which adds a great deal to the game. I myself have chosen to go onto PvE servers where players team up to survive and take on the Zeds and AI Bandits and love it. This mod will surely give me thousands of hours of gameplay, and not very many games can pull that off for me. I'm way behind everyone else getting into this DayZ craze, I avoided it for a long time because despite all the die hard fans, a lot complained about bugs and issues, but I myself have run into very few bugs (Most of which were on the basic version installed here on Steam) and none of them were game breaking. If you see ArmA2 Combined Ops on sale, buy it.

content:
y 21, 2015
												DayZ Review:I entered the game. I got a message, "Cannot connect to servers" I'm shaking. I put on my cardboard decoy of the oculus rift as I enter this zombie infested land. I hear people walking towards me. "Take the dog out!" I hear. My friend told me to say I'm friendly. "I'm Friendly" I shout. I feel what felt like a punch to my stomach. The man left. I look at the bottom right of my stomach. I'm starving. I can't get to the fridge... It's to far away. I'm also thirsty but when am I not? I swear everything is blurring out... This game is feeling too real. I went down the stairs to see 3 guys, a man who looked old, a young man, and a baby. "Go upstairs conor" How did he know my name? I ran in panic and ripped of my Fabulous rift. This is almost as scary as freddy foozbear. 10/10 Best survival game to exsist, better than call of duty- ign
